Description: One half of a bronze mirror-case; circular disc with raised edges, inside surface still retaining its polished surface; the exterior is decorated with incised or cast concentric circles, one of which forms a pronounced ridge on the inside surface; surface heavily encrusted.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Curium
Curator's comments: M.-J. Chavane, La nécropole d’Amathonte Tombs 110-385. IV. Les petits objets (Nicosia 1990), pp. 14-15 for parallels from Amathus.
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.85, Tomb 68 no. 3)
